docs.lead_paragraph: Lots of comments on my medical column on Sunday. Paul from Hamilton, Ontario writes: "The Canadian health system is broken too...So someone like me can't find a doctor unless he/she knows the right people. So new immigrants in Canada --and there are a lot of us -- may not be much better off than in the U.S."

docs.lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, we have an opportunity to construct something far more important than higher levees -- a national health care system that looks less like a tightrope and more like a safety net. A dozen years after Bill Clinton's health reform efforts were destroyed by the insurance industry's duplicity, it's worth trying again. The health care system is steadily becoming more gummed up in ways that are impossible to hide.
docs.snippet: In the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, we have an opportunity to construct a national health care system that looks less like a tightrope and more like a safety net.
